channel.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
channel.description:
People have a lot of favorite games. I have a lot of favorite games. But what are your all time most favorites that sit right at the top for being Awesome to you. Also give reasons as to why is it your favorite, as a brief summary.
Mine are:
1. Half-Life - Do i [b]NEED[/b] to say something!!
2. Half-Life 2: Episode 2 - No other game has pulled me in as much as Ep:2 did. The constant rush of emotions, the immersive gameplay, etc was just too much. If you call yourself a gamer even by the slightest, play the HL series and experience something that you probably won't experience ever again. Or maybe till Ep:3. :stuck_out_tongue:
2.5. Half-life 2 and Ep:1 - Almost the same reasons as above.
3. As much as i think about it, i just can't select a number 3. I've plenty that might fit in, i just can't remember anything. Will change once i remember.
Share the Fun! :smiley:

item.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
item.dc:creator: Joka
item.description:
Console:

KINGDOM HEARTS: I have never in my entire time as a gamer been so engaged with the characters and storyline of a game. It was probably one of the first games I’ve ever played, and I still play it to this day. ( Literally, I played today )

BIOSHOCK: I think I liked this game because of two things. The weapons system was something I liked because you could experiment, and in a way make your own sort of unofficial combos. The other thing is that the story was incredible. I think a book could be written about it. Haha.

MIRROR’S EDGE: I don’t know how to explain this game. I do really love the idea of a parkour game, but I think the real grab for me was the song “Still Alive” since I can only now associate that song with this game.

PC:

PORTAL 2: Not only did it give a sequal to my favorite puzzle game of all time, but it added a story too it. And a DAMN good one at that. Oh, plus, wheatley. And space core. And turret opera.

MAGICKA: Humorous. Fun. Creative. Co-op.

HALF LIFE 2: I don’t think this one needs much explanation.

Close Runners Up:
MINECRAFT
BORDERLANDS
OCARINA OF TIME
LEFT 4 DEAD
TEAM FORTRESS 2

And in a matter of just pure fun, Halo 3. Custom Maps. Campaign. Forge. I have WAY too many memories in this game to fit in my head. I think probably one of the funnest times I had on Xbox was trying to get the Annual VidMaster. ( Back when being up at 1 o’clock was hardcore. )

Read full topic

item.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

He had plenty of good games in there to make up for the guilty gaming.

I haven’t played that many 360 games to begin with. Modern Warfare 2 came with the system, therefore I spent the most time with it. That is, until I was able to get more games. As it stands, I’ve only beaten Bionic Commando: Rearmed, The Orange Box, Resident Evil 5, and Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts in that order.

I’ve also dedicated some time to some multiplayer games including Modern Warfare 2, Battlefield 1943, Left 4 Dead, and Left 4 Dead 2. I guess MW2 really boils down to guilty fun. It’s not the greatest game ever, but it passed the time.

Side note: I had credibility?

Read full topic

item.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
item.dc:creator: NerdRage
item.description:
1. Mass Effect Series (by far my favorite. Amazing story, amazing charactors, amazing depth. Can’t wait for #3!!!)
  2. Half-Life Series (EP2 was my favorite, never been so emotionally attached to a game. Actually teared up a little when (SPOILER: [COLOR=‘Black’]Eli dies at the end)
  3. This is hard so I am picking a few… Fallout 3 and NV, Bioshock Series, GTA Series, and Skyrim and TF2 and Portal 2 lol

item.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
ac3d:

You better be editing Donkey Kong Land into the Gameboy section

Donkey Kong Land was basically a portable version of the Country series. The DKC titles were better anyways. I’m referring specifically to Donkey Kong '94. It takes the original concept of DK Arcade and expands on the platforming and puzzle solving elements. It’s essentially what we see in the Mario vs. DK series today, but better. In fact, it used the original levels, and then revealed that there was more game than that.

I highly recommend it if you have yet to play it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

First there was Desert Strike, then Jungle Strike, and lastly Urban Strike. All three were incredibly awesome Genesis games. I had some good times shooting down terrorists.

Yup, I have all three. I like Urban Strike the best though.

item.title: Your Top 3 Favorite Games
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Frankly, we should have separate lists for both types- top three retro and top three 6/7gen.

Retro picks:

  1. Rocket Knight Adventures (Genesis/Mega Drive)
  2. Shinobi III: Revenge of the Ninja Master (Genesis/Mega Drive)
  3. Urban Strike: The Sequel to Jungle Strike (Genesis/Mega Drive, NOT the SNES version. It sucks donkey gonads.)

First there was Desert Strike, then Jungle Strike, and lastly Urban Strike. All three were incredibly awesome Genesis games. I had some good times shooting down terrorists.

Read full topic
